So let me get this straight, Rosetta Stone is a brand name and has nothing to do with the actual rosetta stone?  I see.  You does this compare with your standard pimsleur language pack?

You have to have the Rosetta Stone Application program, it's a manager for all your language discs.

Download the Application, then use Alcohol 120 to burn your language discs to a cd. I've had problems with Greek I and II but my french and russian prgs work fine.

Good luck.

works fine...Downloaded "The Rosetta Stone - Latin - Level I - Units 1-8 iso", open with daemon tools and burn to a CD. After that download "http://thepiratebay.org/details.php?id=3273322" then mount it with daemon tools. go into my computer rigth click the image icon (beside the dvd drive icon) and select "EXPLORE" run the setup and ur good to go.

After mounting it, how do I run the program?  What is SWA format?
@some-young-guy:  .swa is the file extension for "Shockwave Object" (one of the rivals to Adobe Flash, actually.)  You have to have Macromedia Shockwave installed on your computer in order to use it.
